availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Carpenter (Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer and minister)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer and minister. Virginia native. Married to Lucy Custler Carpenter in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in November 1821. Married to Isabella Hite Carpenter in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on February 9, 1826. Father of Robert S. Carpenter. Resident of Oldham County, Kentucky, in 1830. Owned one enslaved person in Oldham County in 1830. Resident of Oldham County in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1840. Farmer and Methodist minister in Oldham County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Farmer in Oldham County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860.
